page.title: 04 LITTLE BROOK POWER STATION
page.content: Ther are four power stations at Little Brook, A.B.C and D but only one is in operation at the present. A power station started working in 1939 and closed in 1971, B station started in 1947 and closed in 1977 and C station started in 1959 and closed in 1981. The D power station started to produce in 1981 and is still operational today. The pwer stations are situated on 179 acres of marsh land and is aprximatley 200 yards from the river Thames. The power station employs 30 women in the offices and 220 men in the central control room and engineering. The fuel they use is oil and is transported by tankers which come up the river Thames. The chimney for the waste gases are very high so as not to polute the atmosphere with dangerous fumes. The cost to build the Power station was 700 million pounds.
